intro: Kentrothamnus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved saltbush, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and saline environments, making it a hardy species in harsh conditions. Kentrothamnus typically grows in coastal and inland areas with poor soil quality. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for native fauna.
